scenarios.title: Places I Can Go

listening.receptive: Demonstrate comprehension of simple spoken instructions.
listening.interactive: Identify the main points in a conversation.

reading.reading1: Outline the meaning of simple paragraphs.
reading.reading2: Follow written instructions for making or doing something simple.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Blend spoken phonemes to form one-syllable or two-syllable words if these words have been previously encountered.

speaking.interactive: Participate in simple dialogues on familiar topics.

writing.productive: Write simple phrases and sentences on familiar topics.
writing.interactive: Write short role plays to be acted out based on class content.

mediation.text: Interpret short, simple messages from class texts.
mediation.communication: Assist peers in following oral directions.

pronunciation: Blending of spoken phonemes to form one-syllable and two-syllable words (e.g., /ɪn/ for 'in')

pragmatic: Describing locations: 'I'm at school.' 'I'm at home.'
Confirming locations: 'Are you at school?' 'Yes, I'm at school.'
sociolinguistic: Polite expressions for responding to compliments about locations (e.g., 'Thank you!' in response to 'Your home is beautiful.')

assessment_ideas: Observe student responses during 'Where Am I?' map activities.
Review digital map tours with 'I'm at...' labels.
Assess use of contractions and prepositions in location drawings.

scenarios.title: A Polite Request

listening.receptive: Respond to basic questions about a familiar story.

reading.reading1: Show comprehension of texts by answering both written and oral questions.
reading.reading2: Identify key details in a story.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Blend spoken phonemes to form one-syllable or two-syllable words if these words have been previously encountered.

speaking.productive: Explain simple rules of a game or activity.

writing.interactive: Write a simple collaborative text with peers.

mediation.communication: Relay simplified explanations of lessons to absent peers.

grammar: Negative contracted form of can (e.g., 'I can't roll the dice.')
Present simple (e.g., 'I have a pencil, but I don't have an eraser.')

pragmatic: Making polite requests: 'Can I have a pencil, please?'
Offering assistance politely: 'Can I help you?' or 'Do you need help?'
sociolinguistic: Expressing inability politely: Using 'can't' in respectful conversation.

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in polite request role-plays.
Review collaborative dialogues with 'Can I...' and 'Sorry, I can't...'.
Assess use of polite expressions in digital posters.

themes: The Book Is on the Table.

listening.receptive: Follow oral directions for simple games.
listening.interactive: Present responses based on listened questions.

reading.reading1: Describe the purpose of everyday texts.

speaking.productive: Share simple stories from books or personal creations.
speaking.interactive: Interact with questions and answers about a classroom topic.

writing.productive: Compose short texts using simple phrases and sentences.
writing.interactive: Respond to written questions from peers.

mediation.text: Explain keywords from readings in simpler terms.
mediation.communication: Facilitate basic peer interactions in group activities.

Confirming object locations: 'It's here.' 'It's on the shelf.'

scenarios.title: This Beautiful Day
themes: It's Raining! I Need an Umbrella.

listening.receptive: Recognize familiar sounds from audio sources.
listening.interactive: Engage in a role-play based on a listened scenario.

reading.reading1: Illustrate the main ideas from a reading in a creative project.

speaking.productive: Describe simple personal experiences and habits.
speaking.interactive: Participate in simple dialogues on familiar topics.

writing.productive: Create descriptive captions for images with simple words.
writing.interactive: Write short role plays to be acted out based on class content.

mediation.text: Interpret short, simple messages from class texts.

grammar: Present simple (e.g., 'I feel happy on sunny days.')

pragmatic: Describing weather and feelings: 'I'm happy.' 'It's raining.'

scenarios.title: It's Time to Eat.

listening.receptive: Demonstrate comprehension of phrases with names and dates in a short, simple recording delivered at a slow pace.
listening.interactive: Present responses based on listened questions.

reading.reading1: Show comprehension of texts by answering questions, both written and oral.
reading.reading2: Write responses to questions about a text.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Blend spoken phonemes to form one-syllable or two-syllable words if these words have been previously encountered.

speaking.productive: Describe objects using basic words or phrases, provided they can prepare in advance.
speaking.interactive: Interact with questions and answers about a classroom topic.

writing.productive: Compose short texts using simple phrases and sentences.
writing.interactive: Respond to written questions from peers.

grammar: WH- and yes/no questions (e.g., 'What's your favorite food?' 'Do you like sancocho?')
Compound sentences with 'but' (e.g., 'I like... but I don't...')

pragmatic: Asking for and giving information about preferences: 'I like apples.' 'Do you like oranges?'
sociolinguistic: Sharing preferences respectfully (e.g., 'I like apples, but I am not a fan of broccoli.')

assessment_ideas: Review favorite food survey charts.
Observe participation in food recipe book creation.
Assess responses to digital food surveys.
